title: Federally Qualified Health Centers
prompt: A weathered rural health center building photographed at golden hour, with a simple entrance and a few patients' cars parked outside, captured from across a quiet road with bare fields visible in the distance. The composition includes hands of a healthcare worker arranging patient intake forms on a worn wooden desk inside, visible through a window with soft afternoon light streaming across. The mood is one of quiet dedication and modest infrastructure—conveying essential service without pretense—with muted earth tones, documentary-style grain, and emphasis on the texture of age, use, and community reliance rather than clinical cleanliness.
